file_insights.impact: Module exports expanded to include inspection-related models

patterns_discovered.description: New model classes are registered by importing from their dedicated modules and adding to __all__ list
patterns_discovered.evidence: ProjectInspection and InspectionFinding imported from app.models.inspection and added to __all__

patterns_discovered.description: Each domain entity has its own module (approval, area, file, audit, inspection) with centralized re-exports
patterns_discovered.evidence: Separate modules for approval, area, file, audit, inspection with centralized imports in __init__.py

patterns_discovered.description: All imported models are consistently added to __all__ for public API exposure
patterns_discovered.evidence: Both ProjectInspection and InspectionFinding added to both import statement and __all__ list

gotchas_discovered.description: The __init__.py file creates tight coupling with the inspection module; changes to inspection.py require no additional changes here, but deletion or renaming would break imports
Import statements and __all__ exports must be manually kept in sync; there's no automatic validation that all imported items are exported or vice versa

approach_outcome.description: Successfully updated the models __init__.py file to expose two new inspection-related model classes
approach_outcome.notes: Task completed in first attempt with straightforward addition of import statement and __all__ entries

recommendations.description: Consider using typing.TypeAlias or similar to document that __all__ contains class references, improving IDE support
For future scalability, evaluate using __getattr__ or similar patterns to automatically export all model classes from submodules without manual maintenance
Consider organizing imports alphabetically (inspection comes after audit but before others) for consistency and easier scanning
